intro: Kerinozoma suraboja, commonly known as the Suraboja orchid, is a rare flowering plant native to the high-altitude regions of Southeast Asia. It belongs to the Orchidaceae family and is characterized by its intricate, fragrant blossoms that bloom in late spring. The plant has slender, strap-like leaves and produces small, clustered flowers in shades of white and pale pink. It thrives in cool, moist environments and requires specific soil conditions to flourish. Due to its limited distribution and habitat specificity, it is considered a vulnerable species.
